Serving¶

train¶

app.train(model_id, model_name, model_desc, graph_name, train_data, test_data, user_id, train_loop_def=None, model_def=None, start_from=None)¶

Execute a training task.

URL format: http://host:port/graph_name/train?model_id=model_id&train_data=train_data&test_data=test_data&user_id=user_id&train_loop_def=train_loop_def&model_def=model_def&start_from=start_from

Parameters

  • model_id – model identification

  • model_name – model name

  • model_desc – model description

  • graph_name – graph to fetch data from

  • train_data – list of date string, e.g., [‘2021-09-15’, ‘2021-10-21’], which specify the train data

  • test_data – list of date string, e.g., [‘2021-09-15’, ‘2021-10-21’], which specify the test data

  • user_id – specify the right point of time window in which data will be fetched

  • train_loop_def – training loop definition in JSON format, see example below for details

  • model_def – definition of model architecture in JSON format, see example below for details

  • start_from – specify the id of model which will be used as basic model to train incrementally from, if start_from was specified, train_loop_def and model_def will be ignored and the architecture of basic model will be used

Returns

model_id, model_status (0 for succeed and -1 for failed) and message in JSON format

Example

>>> import json
>>> conv_layers_def = [
...     [("GCNConv",
...         {"input_dims":128+32,
...         "units":128,
...         "add_self_loop":True,
...         "activation":'relu',
...         "name": "gcn1"}),
...      ("GCNConv",
...          {"input_dims":128,
...          "units":64,
...          "add_self_loop":True,
...          "activation":'relu',
...          "name": "gcn2"})],
... ]
>>> pre_proc_layers_def = [
...     ("IntegerLookupEncoder", {
...         "name": "year_lookup",
...         "cate_feat_def": [("year", {"vocabulary": [1971, 1986, 1987, 1988]+list(range(1990, 2021))}), ]}
...      ),
...     ('EmbeddingEncoder', {
...         "name": "year_emb",
...         "cate_feat_def": [("year", {"reduction": "mean", "input_dim": 37, "output_dim": 32}), ]}
...      ),
...     ('AttrConcat', {"name": "feat_concat"}),
... ]
>>> reduce_layer_def = None
>>> out_layers_def = [("Dense", {"name": "out1", "units": 40}), ]
>>> model_def = json.dumps(
...     {"conv_layers_def": conv_layers_def, "pre_proc_layers_def": pre_proc_layers_def,
...     "reduce_layer_def": reduce_layer_def, "out_layers_def": out_layers_def}
... )
>>> train_loop_def = json.dumps({
...     "optimizer": ("Adam", {}),
...     "loss": ("SparseCategoricalCrossentropy", {"from_logits": True}),
...     "metrics": [("SparseCategoricalAccuracy", {}), ],
...     "epochs": 1,
...     "checkpoint_save_freq": 1,
...     "tensorboard_update_freq": 1
... })

predict¶

app.predict(task_id, graph_name, model_id, predict_data)¶

Execute a prediction task. URL format: http://host:port/graph_name/predict?task_id=task_id&model_id=model_id&predict_data=predict_data

Parameters

  • task_id – id to track task

  • graph_name – graph to fetch data from

  • model_id – id of model to use

  • predict_data – date string, e.g., ‘2021-09-15’, which specify the predict data

Returns

task_id, task_status (0 for succeed and -1 for failed) and message in JSON format

predict_and_explain¶

app.predict_and_explain(task_id, graph_name, model_id, predict_data, target_class, prob_th)¶

Execute a prediction task explain its result. URL format: http://host:port/graph_name/predict_and_explain?task_id=task_id&model_id=model_id&predict_data=predict_data&target_class=target_class&prob_th=prob_th

Parameters

  • task_id – id to track task

  • graph_name – graph to fetch data from

  • model_id – id of model to use

  • predict_data – date string, e.g., ‘2021-09-15’, which specify the predict data

  • target_class – index of target class in predictions to explain

  • prob_th – the threshold of probability, only node with probability of target_class greater than prob_th would be explained

Returns

task_id, task_status (0 for succeed and -1 for failed) and message in JSON format
